intro: Draba laconica, commonly known as the Laconica whitlow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many mustard and cress species. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Draba laconica is often found in open habitats such as cliffs, slopes, and disturbed ground.
